arm_group.arm_group_label: Intensive cycling test preceded by RIPC
arm_group.description: Intensive cycling test preceded by a RIPC protocol.
Intensive cycling test not preceded by a RIPC protocol.

brief_summary.textblock:
Strenuous exercise in apparent healthy individuals increases plasma (high sensitive)
      troponin levels. The underlying mechanism is not yet elucidated, but could be explained by
      changes due to a mismatch in oxygen demand and supply that mimic those of ischemia and
      reperfusion injury. If the mechanism underlying the troponin release during exercise is
      similar to that of ischemia reperfusion injury (IRI), than it should be susceptible to
      remote ischemic preconditioning (RIPC) as RIPC is a well validated technique to reduce IRI.
      To test this hypothesis healthy volunteers underwent a strenuous exercise test with or
      without preceding RIPC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age: 18-45 year

          -  willing to sign informed consent

          -  healthy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  hypertension (systolic blood pressure >140 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > 90
             mmHg)

          -  any cardiovascular abnormality in past medical history, physical examination or ECG,
             including QTc interval

          -  drug abuse

          -  alcohol abuse (> 3 units/day)

          -  smoking during the last 2 years

          -  BMI >30 kg/m2

          -  inability to perform bicycle test

          -  the presence of an absolute or relative contra-indication for exercise (table 2 in
             protocol)

          -  the presence of diabetes (fasting glucose > 6.9 mmol/L, non-fasting glucose >11.0
             mmol/L; if non-fasting glucose is > 6.9 mmol/L, blood glucose measurement will be
             repeated in fasting condition and should then not exceed 6.9 mmol/L)

          -  total cholesterol in blood 6.6 mmol/L or higher

intervention.arm_group_label: Intensive cycling test preceded by RIPC
intervention.description: RIPC protocol which consist of three 5-min cycles of bilateral forearm ischemia

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Remote Ischemic Preconditioning on Plasma Troponin I Appearance After a Standardized Cycling Test in Healthy Volunteers

primary_outcome.description: serum level of high sensitive troponin in response to intensive exercise test with or without RIPC at several timepoints
primary_outcome.measure: serum level of high sensitive troponin at several timepoints
primary_outcome.time_frame: timepoints t= baseline, 0, 1, 2, 3,4 and 8 hours after finishing exercise

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
